text: Guilty or not, people shouldn't take matters into their own hands like this.  I hope the vigilantes are properly punished as well, and for everyone's sake I hope they didn't attack an innocent man.

Everyone deserves due process.  I can understand the overwhelming anger and grief that made these people seek retribution before the man was tried for the crime, but it doesn't make it right.  I hope there's justice for the child's family and that they can find peace.

We worry about so many other things, but we ignore that we need to figure out how to become smarter about changing things for the mentally ill in this country so that we can at least decrease these senseless tragedies.

I am not going to like any comments because I don't like any of the comments. I'm not going to report them because none are offensive. Yet, and despite the fact that I do not want to take any action in response to this article, I am being forced to leave a response in order to continue with the survey. In "real life" I would read this article, and the comments, and leave without any remark or report. Why them am I being forced to respond in a way that is false in order to complete the data collection phase of this experiment?
